title: London fashion week spring/summer 2020: 20 key shows – in pictures
text:
PREEN BY THORNTON AND BREGAZZI Darkly pretty dresses are kind of Preen’s thing, so if you are in to them, you will agree this collection was a corker. More importantly, given the urgency of the climate crisis, it was made from previous seasons’ off-cuts and recycled and sustainably sourced fabrics – the georgette, for example, was produced using old plastic bottles. That the ruffled frocks tended towards black, a gothic – and timeless – spring trend, also felt right. Props to Preen for having recently donated the rest of their waste textiles to initiatives seeking to encourage sewing skills.

Photograph: REX/Shutterstock
description: This season saw a heady mix of schedule regulars as well as up-and-coming stars, with a focus on sustainability
